3: I can't let her know I'm here to save my people...
Those who're trapped inside are on the Purifying Force's kill list.
It's already difficult to rescue someone in a heavily guarded place...
It's not going to end well for my men if Bianca and her team get involved as well.
(Looks around) If I had built this place, I would've put the cells at the lowest level.
If I can find a map of this place, not only will I locate the cells, but I can also avoid all these guards on the way.
Speaking of which... this has been quite an eye-opening rescue op.
I can't believe such a sanctuary would still exist on Earth—the level of Punish Virus concentration here is way too low.
That's probably what Bianca is after here...
Which means there are other teams here apart from her.
If Nikola figured out that there may be an antidote here for the virus...
He wouldn't stop, no matter how many lives of his soldiers it costs him.
...Nikola is a piece of shit, but he's no gambler.
He must've held some concrete intel to send the Purifying Force. It means that this antidote may actually be real...
A cure... to the Punishing Virus...
No cure is more important than the lives of my people.
I'll leave saving the world to Babylonia.
How do I get my hands on a map of this place?
